data.text: Pakistan and her neighbours
Pakistan is situated in the continent of Asia.
The latitudinal extent of Pakistan is 24°N and 37°N.
The longitudinal extent of Pakistan is 61°E and 76°E.
Pakistan shares its border with Afghanistan and Iran in the west.
Pakistan shares border with China and India in the north and east.
In the south, Pakistan has an 800 km coastline along the Arabian Sea.
Iran is a country of deserts and plateaus surrounded by mountains.
Iran was earlier known as Persia.
The capital of Iran is Tehran.
The population of Iran consists of Persians, Turks, Kurds, Armenians, and Arabs.
Iran is an agricultural country. Wheat, rice, tobacco, and sugar beet are grown in Iran.
Iran has 10% of the world's oil reserves and also has natural gas, copper, iron ore, lead, and precious stones.
In 1979, Ayatollah Khomeini took over the government in an Islamic Revolution.
Afghanistan is a mountainous country with cold winters and dry summers.
The capital of Afghanistan is Kabul.
The population of Afghanistan is made up of ethnic groups like Pashtuns, Uzbeks, and Tajiks.
All major land routes from the Middle East to the subcontinent pass through Afghanistan.
Afghanistan became a strong country under Ahmed Shah Durrani in 1747.
In recent years, Afghanistan has suffered a lot of destruction due to political unrest.
China is a very large country compared to Pakistan.
Pakistan is separated from China by the Karakoram range.
Beijing is the capital city of China.
Mandarin Chinese is the official language of China.
China is mainly an agricultural country.
In 1949, the Chinese Communist Party came to power under the leadership of Mao Zedong.
The communist party founded the new People's Republic of China.
India is a large country situated to the east of Pakistan.
Pakistan and India shared a common history until 1947.
India is basically an agricultural country.
India has developed many large industries.
The great river Ganges flows through the northern plains of India.
The Deccan Plateau covers most of the southern part of India.
New Delhi is the capital of India.
Hindi and English are the official languages of India.
Pakistan shares a good relationship with other Muslim countries of the world.
